snippet: HOHOL--Barbara (Baer), passed away May 29 after a courageous final battle with cancer. Grateful for the six years she had after the first diagnosis, she lived well, traveling when she could and enjoying music and theatre. She was a community gardener, activist, craftswoman, and avid collector of folk art and crafts including northwestern coast and African sculpture and southwestern pottery. Her Upper Westside neighbors will miss her. Cats, Imp and Goblin seem happy together in their new home. A memorial celebration will be held at St. John the Divine on Monday, June 20 at 5pm. 1/3
lead_paragraph: HOHOL--Barbara (Baer), passed away May 29 after a courageous final battle with cancer. Grateful for the six years she had after the first diagnosis, she lived well, traveling when she could and enjoying music and theatre. She was a community gardener, activist, craftswoman, and avid collector of folk art and crafts including northwestern coast and African sculpture and southwestern pottery. Her Upper Westside neighbors will miss her. Cats, Imp and Goblin seem happy together in their new home. A memorial celebration will be held at St. John the Divine on Monday, June 20 at 5pm. 1/3
